Item ID2114

A pineapple is a fruit that can be found growing just south of Brimhaven or on a player grown Pineapple plant. Additionally, they may be purchased from Trader Crewmembers operating Trader Stan's Trading Post, Funch's Shop from Heckel Funch, or from Hudo Glenfad in the Grand Tree Groceries store.

A wild pineapple plant found south of Brimhaven.

Pineapples provide an easy way to make supercompost by putting it into a compost bin, as they are relatively cheap and easy to obtain. It can be sliced or diced with a knife. Slicing the pineapple will yield 4 pineapple rings, each healing 2 hitpoints. Dicing the pineapple yields one pineapple chunks, an ingredient used in gnome cooking, which also heals 2 hitpoints when consumed. When slicing the pineapple into pineapple rings if you don't have enough space in your inventory, the rings will drop to the ground instead.

10 pineapples are also used as a payment for papaya trees.

For Ironman accounts, pineapples are the most accessible ingredient for making supercompost, as they are sold at Trader Stan's Trading Post.

Changes[edit | edit source]

Date Changes
23 May 2013
(update | poll)

Pineapples and watermelons now have 'Use' as their left-click option, rather than 'Eat'.

7 August 2006
(update)

The item's value was increased from 1 to 2.

11 July 2005
(update)

The item was graphically updated with the release of Farming.

{{External|rs|rsc}} {{otheruses|def=no|the [[scenery]] seen near the [[Temple of the Eye (location)|Temple of the Eye]]|Pineapple (Temple of the Eye)}} {{Infobox Item |name = Pineapple |image = [[File:Pineapple.png]] |release = [[15 August]] [[2002]] |update = Sheep and cults |members = Yes |quest = No |tradeable = Yes |placeholder = Yes |equipable = No |stackable = No |noteable = Yes |options = Eat |destroy = Drop |examine = It can be cut up into something more manageable with a knife. |value = 2 |weight = 0.150 |exchange = Yes |id = 2114 }} [[File:Pineapple detail.png|left|120px]] A '''pineapple''' is a fruit that can be found growing just south of [[Brimhaven]] or on a player grown [[Pineapple plant]]. Additionally, they may be purchased from [[Trader Crewmember]]s operating [[Trader Stan's Trading Post]], [[Funch's Fine Groceries|Funch's Shop]] from [[Heckel Funch]], or from [[Hudo|Hudo Glenfad]] in the [[Grand Tree Groceries]] store. [[File:Pineapple Plant location.png|right|thumb|A wild [[Pineapple Plant (wild)|pineapple plant]] found south of [[Brimhaven]].]] Pineapples provide an easy way to make [[supercompost]] by putting it into a [[Compost Bin|compost bin]], as they are relatively cheap and easy to obtain. It can be sliced or diced with a [[knife]]. Slicing the pineapple will yield 4 [[pineapple ring]]s, each healing 2 [[hitpoints]]. Dicing the pineapple yields one [[pineapple chunks]], an ingredient used in [[gnome cooking]], which also heals 2 hitpoints when consumed. When slicing the pineapple into [[pineapple ring]]s if you don't have enough space in your [[inventory]], the rings will drop to the ground instead. 10 pineapples are also used as a payment for [[Papaya tree seed|papaya trees]]. For Ironman accounts, pineapples are the most accessible ingredient for making [[supercompost]], as they are sold at [[Trader Stan's Trading Post]]. ==Products== {{Uses material list|Pineapple}} ==Item sources== {{Drop sources|Pineapple}} ===Shop locations=== {{Store locations list|Pineapple}} ==Changes== {{Subject changes header}} {{Subject changes |date = 23 May 2013 |update = Patch Notes (23 May 2013) |poll = Old School feature poll 4 ‚Äì May 2013 |change = Pineapples and watermelons now have 'Use' as their left-click option, rather than 'Eat'. }} {{Subject changes |date = 7 August 2006 |update = Gnome Cuisine |change = The item's value was increased from 1 to 2. }} {{Subject changes |date = 11 July 2005 |update = Farming |change = The item was graphically updated with the release of [[Farming]]. }} {{Subject changes footer}} ===Gallery (historical)=== {|style="text-align: center" cellpadding="15" |[[File:Pineapple detail (beta).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Pineapple detail (historical).png|center|300x150px]] |[[File:Pineapple detail.png|center|300x150px]] |- |[[File:Pineapple (beta).png|center]] |[[File:Pineapple (historical).png|center]] |[[File:Pineapple.png|center]] |- |RuneScape 2
